metadata.title: CVE-2016-2834 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.23, as used in MozillaFirefox before 47.0, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory corruption and application crash) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2834` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
nss package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.23-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
